result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario H. Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case No. 2016CM000186

miscConds.notes: Court Costs paid in full from cash bond previously posted.  The balance of the cash bond has been applied to companion Waushara Co Case No. 2016CM000186.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with the victim as named in the Complaint.
No DNA sample ordered as Defendant previously provided the same through another conviction.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario H. Hernandez

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 16CM-155 and 16CM-186 w/16TR-1225 - Both Cases Called @ 2:48 PM: Defendant Mario H. Hernandez in court with attorney Amaro Lopez.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Interpreter oath given by the Court.  Global Joint Resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.    Defendant advised of permissible punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed and VIS filed as to both matters.  16CM-155 Ct 1 DC Dom Plea: GP   16CM-186 Amended Complaint Ct Nos 1-4 Pleas:  GP  Court accepts all pleas and enters JOC.  16CM-155 Ct 2 DRI.  16CM-186 Ct Nos 5-9 All DRI.  16TR-1225 DRI.  Statement by Def:  None offered.  The Court:  Accepts resolution 16CM-155 - Ct 1 - S/W 2 yrs probation and Ct Nos 1, 2 and 3 of 16CM-186 - S/W - 2 yrs probation.  Conditions for both cases: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.; No Contact with victim; AODA, Rest of $315.29 - bond to first be applied to Rest and then the balance to financial obligations, and Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.   16CM-186 - Ct 4:  37 days WCJ, Report 10/1/2016, Huber, GT and No TS credit; Fine of $1618 with $42.50 Blood Draw Fee with any remaining bond to be applied, 16 mos DL Rev/IID.  DNA Sample on file, however Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Hispanic Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Amaro Lopez in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Lopez requests additional status.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 09:35 am.

CASH BOND ORDERED AS TO BOTH WAUSHARA CO CASE NOS. 2016CM000155 AND 2016CM000186.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

16CM-155 and 16CM-186 with 16TR-1225 - All Cases Called @ 2:50 PM: Defendant Mario H. Hernandez in court with attorney Amaro Lopez.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.  16CM-155:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  16CM-186:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered as to both cases.  Court notes the bond posted as to 16CM-186.   ADA argues for single cash bond as to both cases.  Argument as to cash bond by Atty Lopez and speak as to no contact request made.  Victim is not present.  ADA confirms that there has been no response from victim as of today's hearing.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 03:20 pm.
